intro: Tragia discolor var. linearis, commonly known as the slender tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry regions.
